properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: UNIT 3F WITHOUT CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

(13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND FLOOR APARTMENT/ SMOKE DETECTOR- MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND FLOOR APARTMENT/ CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: ATTIC APARTMENT - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BUILDING IS A WOOD FRAMED TWO STORY, TWO UNIT STRUCTURE WITH A BASEMENT AND ATTIC.  AT THE FRONT THE DILAPIDATED FACADE IS PARTIALLY CLOAKED IN A LARGE PLASTIC TARP AND APPEARS TO BE VACANT.  HOWEVER, AT THE REAR ONE CAN OBSERVE RECENT ALTERATIONS.                                        AT THE EXTERIOR WORK INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO:  1. NEW PORCH ENCLOSURE FROM GROUND LEVEL TO ATTIC WITH SCAFFOLD IN PLACE.  SEE NEW PLYWOOD SHEATHING AND NEW SIDING INSTALLATION IN PROGRESS.   2. AT THE ROOF TWO NEW DORMERS HAVE BEEN INSTALLED NEAR THE REAR OF BUILDING.  ONE AT THE WEST AND THE OTHER AT THE EAST.   3. THE ROOF WAS RECENTLY RESHINGLED.     AT THE INTERIOR WORK INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO:   1. ALL WOOD LATH AND PLASTER REMOVED FROM WALLS AND CEILINGS ON ALL LEVELS EXCEPT AT THREE BEDROOMS ON FIRST FLOOR.   2. NEW WOOD PARTITION WALLS ERECTED AT BASEMENT, FIRST, SECOND AND ATTIC LEVELS.   3. NEW FLOOR FRAMING MEMBERS INSTALLED AT FIRST, SECOND AND ATTIC FLOORS.   4. REAR HALF OF BASEMENT WAS EXCAVATED APPROXIMATELY 16 INCHES TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE HEAD ROOM.  SEE NEW BATHROOM IN BASEMENT.  NEW CONCRETE FLOOR AND NEW CONCRETE FOUNDATION WALLS AT REAR PORCH ENCLOSURE.   5. NEW 6 IN. X 8 IN. WOOD BEAMS AND COLUMNS INSTALLED FROM FRONT TO REAR IN BASEMENT WITH NEW CONCRETE FOOTINGS.   6. ORIGINAL HEATING AND PLUMBING SYSTEMS REMOVED AND MOST OF ORIGINAL ELECTRICAL SYSTEM REMOVED.  SEE NEW GAS FIRED FORCED WARM AIR FURNACES AND NEW HOT WATER HEATER.  ALSO NEW COPPER AND PVC SUPPLY AND WASTE PIPING.  THE HEATING UNITS AND HOT WATER HEATER COMBUSTION GASES ARE BEING VENTED THROUGH THE SIDE WALLS ADJACENT TO NEIGHBORS FIRST FLOOR WINDOWS.   7. ELECTRICAL POWER SERVICE IS HANGING PRECARIOUSLY AT REAR EXTERIOR.  TWO NEW ELECTRICAL CURRENT BREAKER PANELS INSTALLED IN BASEMENT AND ONE  AT ATTIC.  DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM IS A COMBINATION OF ARMORED CABLE AND PLASTIC SHEATHED ROMEX WHICH IS HANGING LOOSELY AND EXPOSED THROUGHOUT THE INTERIOR.  8. MAKESHIFT BATHROOM INSTALLED AT BASEMENT AND FIRST FLOOR ALONG WITH A TEMPORARY KITCHEN ON THE FIRST FLOOR.  9. ATTIC STORAGE SPACE BEING CONVERTED TO A DWELLING UNIT.  SPACE HAS BEEN ROUGHED-OUT TO INCLUDE  KITCHEN AND BATHROOM.  THE SPACE LACKS REQUIRED SECONDARY MEANS OF EGRESS AND FAILS TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE HEADROOM.   10. INSPECTORS FOUND OWNER OCCUPANTS RESIDING IN INCOMPLETE ACTIVE REHABILITATION PROJECT ON FIRST FLOOR.  SEE THREE BEDROOMS WITH BEDS, BEDDING, FURNITURE AND OTHER PERSONAL PROPERTY.  AT MAKESHIFT KITCHEN SEE PLATES, CUPS, POTS AND FOOD STUFFS.  AT BATHROOMS SEE PERSONAL TOILETRIES.  AT BATHROOMS WALLS ARE EXPOSED WOOD FRAMING AND DO NOT PROVIDE PRIVACY.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Performed or allowed work to be performed without submitting plans prepared, signed and sealed by a licensed architect or registered structural engineer for approval and without obtaining a permit to perform the work.  (13-32-010, 13-32-040, 13-40-020, 13-12-050)

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: DWELLING UNITS, STAIRWELLS AND BASEMENT WITHOUT SMOKE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: ENTIRE BUILDING WITHOUT CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR-MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND FLOOR-MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.
